gurmukhi: ੲਿਤਿ ਸ੍ਰੀ ਬਚਿਤ੍ਰ ਨਾਟਕ ਗ੍ਰੰਥੇ ਕਲਕੀ ਅਵਤਾਰ ਸੰਭਰ ਨਰੇਸ਼ ਬਧਹ ਬਿਜਯ ਭੲੇਤ ਬਰਨਨੰ ਨਾਮ ਸੰਭਰ ਜੁੱਧ ਧਿਅਾੲਿ ਸਮਾਪਤਮ ਸਤੁ ਸੁਭਮ ਸਤੁ ||
transliteration: It(i) Sribachitra Naatak Granthe Kalkiavtaar Sanbhar Daresh Badhah Bijay Bhaet Arnanan Naam Sanbhar Juddh Dhiaae Samaaptam Sat(u) Soubham Sat(u)||
translation: End of the Chapter entitled “the Kalki Incarnation after killing the king of Sambhal becomes victorious-the description of the war of Sambhal” Bachittar Natak.
Now begins the description of war with various countries.

gurmukhi: ਹਣਯੋ ਸੰਭਰੇਸੰ || ਚਤੁਰ ਚਾਰ ਦੇਸੰ || ਚਲੀ ਧਰਮ ਚਰਚਾ || ਕਰੈ ਕਾਲ ਅਰਚਾ ||੪੫੫||
transliteration: Hanyo Sanbhresan|| Chatur Chaar Desan|| Chalidharma Charchaa|| Darai Kaal Archaa||455||
translation: The king of Sambhal was killed and there was discussion regarding dharma in all the four directions; people made offerings to Kalki.455.

gurmukhi: ਜਿਤਿਓ ਦੇਸ ਅੈਸੇ || ਚੜਿਓ ਕੋਪ ਕੈਸੇ || ਬੁਲਿਓ ਸਰਬ ਸੈਣੰ || ਕਰੇ ਰਕਤ ਨੈਣੰ ||੪੫੬||
transliteration: Jitio Des Aise|| Chadio Kop Kaise|| Bulio Sarab Sainan|| Dare Rakar Nainan||456||
translation: While the whole of the country was conquered, kalki got infuriated and he reddening his eyes, called all his army.456.

gurmukhi: ਦੲੀ ਜੀਤ ਬੰਬੰ || ਗਡਿਓ ਜੁੱਧ ਖੰਭੰ || ਚਮੂੰ ਚੳੁਪ ਚਾਲੀ || ਥਿਰਾ ਸਰਬ ਹਾਲੀ ||੪੫੭||
transliteration: Daijeet Banban|| Gadio Juddh Khanbhan|| Chamoond Chaoup Dhaalee|| Thiraa Sarabdhaalee||457||
translation: He sounded the horn of victory and he planted the column of war again; the whole army in great zeal, marched forward and the whole earth trembled.457.

gurmukhi: ੳੁਠੀ ਕੰਪ ਅੈਸੇ || ਨਦੰ ਨਾਵ ਜੈਸੇ || ਚੜੇ ਚੳੁਪ ਸੂਰੰ || ਰਹਿਓ ਧੂਰ ਪੂਰੰ ||੪੫੮||
transliteration: Outhikanp Aise|| Nadan Naav Jaise|| Chade Chaoup Sooran || Rahio Dhoor Pooran||458||
translation: The earth trembled like the boat in water; the warriors moved with great excitement and the atmosphere was filled with dust on all the sides.458.

gurmukhi: ਛੁਭੇ ਛੱਤ੍ਰਧਾਰੀ || ਅਣੀ ਜੋੜ ਭਾਰੀ || ਚਲੇ ਕੋਪ ਅੈਸੇ || ਬ੍ਰਿਤੰ ੲਿੰਦ੍ਰ ਜੈਸੇ ||੪੫੯||
transliteration: Chhoubhe Chhattradhdaree|| Anijod Bhdaree|| Chale Kop Aise|| Britan Indra Jaise||459||
translation: All those who had canopies over their heads, got infuriated; taking with them all their armies, in anger, they marched like Indra or Vritasura.459.

gurmukhi: ਸੁਭੇ ਸਰਬ ਸੈਣੰ || ਕਥੈ ਕੌਣ ਬੈਣੰ || ਚਲੀ ਸਾਜ ਸਾਜਾ || ਬਜੈ ਜੀਤ ਬਾਜਾ ||੪੬੦||
transliteration: Soubhe Sarab Sainan|| Kathai Kaoun Bainan|| Chalisaaj Saajaa|| Bajai Jeet Baajaa||460||
translation: The glory of their armies is indescribable; all of them marched after bedcking themselves and the instruments of victory were played.460.

gurmukhi: ਜਿਣੇ ਗੱਖਰੀ ਪੱਖਰੀ ਖੱਗ ਧਾਰੀ || ਹਣੇ ਪੱਖਰੀ ਭੱਖਰੀ ਅੌ ਕੰਧਾਰੀ || ਗਜਸੁਤਾਨ ਗਾਜੀ ਰਜੀ ਰੋਹ ਰੂਮੀ || ਹਣੇ ਸੂਰ ਬੰਕੇ ਗਿਰੇ ਝੂਮ ਭੂਮੀ ||੪੬੧||
transliteration: Jine Gadkharipakkharikhagg Dhdaree|| Hane Pakkharibhakkhariau Kandhdaree|| Gadasoutaan Gadjirajiroh Roomee|| Hane Soor Banke Gire Jhoom Bhoomee||461||
translation: Many bloody and great sword-wielders and armour-wearers were conquered; many Kandhari warriors, wearing large steel-armours, were destroyed; many elegant warriors of Rum country were killed and those great warriors swung and fell on the earth.461.

gurmukhi: ਹਣੇ ਕਾਬਲੀ ਬਾਬਲੀ ਬੀਰ ਬਾਂਕੇ || ਕੰਧਾਰੀ ਹਰੇਵੀ ੲਿਰਾਕੀ ਨਿਸਾਕੇ || ਬਲੀ ਬਾਲਖੀ ਰੋਹ ਰੂਮੀ ਰਜੀਲੇ || ਭਜੇ ਤ੍ਰਾਸ ਕੈ ਕੈ ਭੲੇ ਬੰਦ ਢੀਲੇ ||੪੬੨||
transliteration: Hane Kaabalibaabalibeer Baanke|| Kandhaari Dareviiraakinisaake|| Balibaalakhiroh Roomirajeele|| Bhaje Traas Kai Kai Bhae Band Dheele||462||
translation: The warriors of Kabul, Babylonia, Kandhar, Iraq and Balkh were destroyed an d they all, getting fearful, fled away.462.

gurmukhi: ਤਜੇ ਅਸਤ੍ਰ ਸ਼ਸਤ੍ਰੰ ਸਜੇ ਨਾਰਿ ਭੇਸੰ || ਲਜੈ ਬੀਰ ਧੀਰੰ ਚਲੇ ਛਾਡ ਦੇਸੰ || ਗਜੀ ਬਾਜ ਗਾਜੀ ਰਥੀ ਰਾਜ ਹੀਣੰ || ਤਜੈ ਬੀਰ ਧੀਰੰ ਭੲੇ ਅੰਗ ਛੀਣੰ ||੪੬੩||
transliteration: Taje Asta Shastran Saje Naat(i) Bhesan|| Lajai Beer Dhderan Chale Chhaad Desan|| Gadi Baaj Gadjirathiraaj Heenan|| Tajai Beer Dhderan Bhae An Chheenan||463||
translation: The warriors, abandoning their arms and weapons, assumed the garb of women and getting ashamed, left their own country; the elephant-riders, the horse-riders and chariot-riders were deprived of their kingdom and the warriors forsaking forbearance, became
